data.title: Sofi Thanhauser
data.meta_description: Sofi Thanhauser is a writer and artist, and the author of Worn: A People's History of Clothing (Allen Lane, 2022)
data.text:
Self and wellbeing

Sewing and making clothes can inspire, heal or bind us to the past

Whether it’s making a heroine’s costume or using a traditional fabric, stitching garments can guide us in life

The long read

Behind the label: how the US stitched up the Honduras garment industry

The long read: Among the manifold complexities of the global supply chain, a simple principle holds: corporations will always go where their costs – and their responsibilities – can be kept to an absolute minimum
